educations.schoolName: Chicago-Kent College of Law, Illinois Institute of Technology

positions.description:
Staff Judge Advocate.

Accomplishments:

In 2007, under hostile fire conditions in Baghdad, Iraq, managed a legal office with 10 military attorneys, 5 military paralegals, and 6 civilian linguists; ensured timely and efficient review of 14,000 potential terrorists.  

Hand-selected as legal advisor to Navy Admiral in Kurdistan, Iraq, for meetings with high-ranking Iraqi government officials. 

Recently promoted to Captain, one rank below Admiral.
positions.title: Reserve Judge Advocate General's Corps

positions.description:
Directed pro-Israel activities in the East Bay, Sacramento, and Northern Nevada.  My portfolio included lobbying, grassroots organizing, political party work, and coalition building.  I spoke to numerous groups throughout the region on everything from the U.S.-Israel relationship, to Israel, l-related policy on Capitol Hill, to the geo-political climate of the modern Middle East, to the importance of grassroots political involvement.

Successfully lobbied members of congress on numerous pieces of legislation, including the Foreign Aid bill and the Iran Sanctions Enabling Act.
positions.title: Area Director

positions.companyName: Hancock Rothert & Bunshoft (acquired by Duane Morris)
positions.description:
Litigated complex business, employment, and consumer class action cases.  Drafted complaints and motions. Propounded discovery. Represented clients at mediations and settlement conferences.

Accomplishments: 

Obtained summary judgment on multi-million dollar insurance coverage case.

Took and defended numerous depositions in a highly publicized employment law class action lawsuit against major Silicon Valley tech company.
positions.title: Senior Associate Attorney

positions.description:
Litigated civil elder abuse, predatory lending, qui tam, security, and consumer class action cases.  Drafted complaints and complex motions. Took and defended 10 lay and expert depositions in publicized nursing home suit that settled favorably for plaintiffs.  

Successfully settled multi-million dollar consumer class action lawsuit against major San Francisco bank.
positions.title: Associate Attorney

positions.description:
Prosecuted administrative, civil, and criminal security enforcement and consumer protection cases.  Wrote complaints and indictments.  Drafted appeals before the Nevada Supreme Court.  Presented evidence at administrative hearings, preliminary hearings, and grand juries.  

Accomplishments:

Named âRookie of the Yearâ as best new attorney. 

Successfully prosecuted largest securities fraud case in State of Nevada and appeared on Americaâs Most Wanted as lead prosecutor of fugitive.  

Settled numerous complex criminal security fraud enforcement cases.
positions.title: Deputy Attorney General

positions.description:
Trial Counsel (October 1997-April 1998)	
Prosecuted military defendants.  Litigated numerous contested jury trials and preliminary hearings on charges such as arson, theft, insurance fraud, drunk driving, and drug distribution.  

Defense Counsel (January 1996-June 1997)
Represented military defendants on charges such as attempted murder, rape, forcible sodomy, fraternization, theft, assault, adultery, and drug use and distribution. Argued numerous jury trials, administrative discharge board hearings, preliminary hearings, boards of inquiry, and bail hearings.  

Accomplishments:

Achieved acquittals in 10 contested jury trials as defense counsel.

Favorably settled over 40 criminal cases as defense counsel and as prosecutor.
